    Privacy Policy

    Honest insights include how we handle your data and your rights.

    Privacy Policy

    Last updated: 22 November 2025

    Who we are

    Revuary (“we”, “us”, “our”) operates the website at https://www.revuary.co.uk/. We are the data controller for personal data processed via this site.

    Contact: privacy@revuary.co.uk

    Scope

    This policy explains what personal data we collect, how we use and share it, our legal bases under UK GDPR, how long we keep it, and your rights. It applies to visitors and users of our website and related services that link to this policy.

    Data we collect

    Data you provide

    • Contact details: When you email us or submit a form (e.g., name, email, message).
    • Preferences and feedback: Content category interests, comments, or survey responses.

    Data we collect automatically

    • Device and usage data: IP address, browser type, pages viewed, time on page, referring URLs.
    • Cookies and similar technologies: See the Cookies section below for details and choices.

    How we use your data

    • Provide and improve the site: Operate content, troubleshoot, and enhance performance.
    • Analytics: Understand traffic, measure engagement, and improve user experience.
    • Communications: Respond to messages and manage queries you initiate.
    • Advertising: Serve and measure ads if enabled and consented (see Cookies and Ads).
    • Safety and compliance: Detect abuse, secure our services, and comply with legal obligations.

    Our legal bases under UK GDPR

    • Consent: For non-essential cookies, analytics, and personalised advertising.
    • Legitimate interests: To maintain and secure our site, prevent misuse, and understand aggregated performance.
    • Contract: If we provide a service you request that requires contact or delivery details.
    • Legal obligation: To comply with applicable laws, requests from authorities, or tax/accounting requirements.

    Cookies and ads

    We use cookies and similar technologies to remember preferences, perform analytics, and support advertising. Non-essential cookies (including analytics or personalised ads) are only used with your consent.

    • Essential cookies: Needed for site functionality and security.
    • Analytics cookies: Help us understand traffic and improve content.
    • Advertising cookies: Support ad delivery and measurement; may be set by third parties.

    Manage your preferences anytime via our cookie banner or settings: Cookie preferences.

    Note: Third parties involved in analytics or ads may process data for their purposes subject to their privacy policies.

    Who we share data with

    • Service providers: Hosting, analytics, consent management, and advertising partners.
    • Authorities: If required by law or to protect rights, safety, and security.
    • Business transfers: If we reorganise, merge, or transfer our operations, data may be part of the transaction.

    We require service providers to process personal data only on our instructions and with appropriate safeguards.

    International data transfers

    If personal data is transferred outside the UK, we implement safeguards such as UK-approved standard contractual clauses or ensure the destination offers adequate protection under applicable law. We assess transfers and apply supplementary measures where needed.

    How long we keep your data

    • Contact records: Up to 24 months after our last interaction, unless needed longer for legal purposes.
    • Analytics data: Retained according to our analytics tool settings and aggregation needs.
    • Cookie consents: Stored to honour and audit your choices, typically 12–24 months.

    We may keep data longer if required by law or to establish, exercise, or defend legal claims. When no longer needed, we delete or de-identify it.

    Your rights

    Under UK GDPR, you have the right to request: access to your data; correction of inaccuracies; deletion; restriction of processing; data portability; and to object to processing based on legitimate interests or for direct marketing. You can also withdraw consent at any time where processing relies on consent.

    To exercise your rights, contact us at privacy@revuary.co.uk. We may need to verify your identity. You have the right to lodge a complaint with the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) if you are dissatisfied with our response.

    Children’s privacy

    Our content is aimed at a general audience and is not directed to children. If you believe a child has provided personal data to us, please contact us so we can take appropriate steps.

    Security

    We use technical and organisational measures to protect personal data against unauthorised access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. No system is completely secure; we continually review and strengthen our safeguards.

    Changes to this policy

    We may update this policy from time to time. We will post the revised version here and update the “Last updated” date. Significant changes may be communicated via the site or by contacting you if appropriate.

    Contact us

    Questions or requests? Email privacy@revuary.co.uk.
